com.ojcoleman.europa.core

Class Run

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ComponentBase
          • com.ojcoleman.europa.core.Run
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable

    public class Run
extends ComponentBase

    Initiates and manages an evolutionary run, implementing the basic core cycle of evaluating a population and then producing a new population according to the results. A run can be started from a saved Run or a configuration file (see Main). Run is designed as a singleton, there should only ever be one instance of a Run.

    The stages of the cycle are implemented by various components whose implementation and parameters can be specified by a JSON configuration file (see ComponentBase and Main). The specific steps of the initialisation and evolutionary cycle, and their corresponding (abstract) classes or interfaces and methods, are:

    • Create an initial template Genotype with Transcriber.getTemplateGenotype().
    • Create an initial population from template Genotype (Population.generate()).
    • Evolutionary cycle
      • Evaluate the fitness of the population with one or more Evaluators.
      • Produce a "rank" value for each member of population according to their overall fitness (accounting for multiple fitness scores/objectives if applicable) via Ranker.rank(Population).
      • Optionally speciate the population via Speciator.speciate(Population, List).
      • Replace some members of the population with new individuals (usually based on the fittest members) via Evolver.evolve(Population)
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

      • defaultNumberFormatStatic

        protected static java.text.DecimalFormat defaultNumberFormatStatic
        Static reference to the (most recent) defaultNumberFormat. This should only be used in classes which do not have a reference to the Component hierarchy.

        @Parameter(description="The name of the run. Default is the name of the configuration file appended with the current date and time.",

        @Component(description="Component(s) for the fitness evaluator(s). By default the first evaluator is considered the Primary evaluator, which may be used by the Transcriber to obtain information about how the genotype should be constructed.",

      • getState

        public java.util.List<ComponentStateLog> getState()
        Description copied from class: ComponentBase
        Sub-classes may override this to provide information (usually simple statistics) about their current state. This is useful for a Monitor or similar that is observing the Component. It is generally a good idea to call the super-method if overriding this method (except for the version defined on ComponentBase itself which does nothing).
        Overrides:
        getState in class ComponentBase
